org.usfirst.frc.team1100.robot.commands.drive

Class ChangeHeadingWhileUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SendableBase
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Command
        • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDCommand
          • org.usfirst.frc.team1100.robot.commands.drive.ChangeHeadingWhileUp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable

    public class ChangeHeadingWhileUp
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDCommand
    This command uses the Drive susbsystem to turn the robot to a desired heading. The direction considered 0 degrees is the direction in which the robot was oriented at the start of the match. Yaw angle (the gyro value) is taken by calling an OI class method, then calling getYaw method. This command uses a PID controller.
    See Also:
    A lesson on what a PID Controller is and how it works.
